entry.title: The Fight for Bitcoin Privacy Has Truly Begun
entry.summary:
This article is featured in Bitcoin Magazine's "The Privacy Issue". Subscribe to receive your copy. First they ignore you, then they laugh at you, then they fight you, then you win.
The quoteâ€”commonly misattributed to Mahatma Gandhiâ€”has been overused to the point of exhaustion in the Bitcoin space, typically invoking the suggestion that the laughing stage is over. In most of these cases, the insinuation that the fighting stage has begun was overblown, however; perhaps inspired by little more than a comment from some politician or finance professional. But on April 24 of this year, the quote finally rang true. On that day, the US Department of Justice (DoJ), via the District Court of the Southern District of New York, announced the indictment of Samourai Wallet co-founders Keonne Rodriguezâ€¦

entry.title: Gigachad: A Crypto Coin With An Alpha Male Mindset
entry.summary: Gigachad is a meme coin centered around a meme that originates from 2017 after a photographer posted a bodybuilder with an unrealistically insane body. He was later named â€˜Gigachadâ€™ by 4Chan users.

entry.title: FOMO HOUR 176 - ETH LEADS THE CHARGE
entry.summary: ETH leads gains in majors, ETHE outflows slowing. Putin signs crypto mining bill. Tether mints another $250m on SOL. Tether plans to double staff to improve compliance. Turkey sees surge in exchange applications. SEC plans to appeal XRP ruling. Franklin Templeton launches fund on ARB. SUI leads altcoins after Grayscale fund announced. TIA rises 20%, will launch mainnet in September. STX will launch final Nakamoto Code this month. Coinbase questions CFTC prediction market rules.
